column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service

There was a smaller yarding of 113 trade and export cattle at Powranna on Tuesday with quality much improved. With good recent rains prices improved 40c to 50c on last weekâ€™s cheaper market. Most yearling steers made 278c to 312c while heifers made 250c to 332c. Grown steers and bullocks improved 40c to make 280c to 340c.

There were about 40 cows and heavy cows improved 10c to 15c to make 232c to 260c while leaner cows made 150c to 224c. Heavy bulls made 180c to 214c/kg live.

Market Reporter Richard Bailey
